body:
We should check if the pre-6.0 implementation based on univocity-parsers supported comments at all. If not, maybe we can disable comment support in FastCSV to fix the regression.

@vdmitrienko Do you have time to take a look?

> [@vdmitrienko](https://github.com/vdmitrienko) Do you have time to take a look?

Yep, will take a look today.

Comment support is a first-class feature for text blocks with `@CsvSource`, like in this [example from the User Guide](https://docs.junit.org/current/user-guide/#writing-tests-parameterized-tests-sources-CsvSource).

```java


@ParameterizedTest
@CsvSource(delimiter = '|', quoteCharacter = '"', textBlock = """
    #-----------------------------
    #    FRUIT     |     RANK
    #-----------------------------
         apple     |      1
    #-----------------------------
         banana    |      2
    #-----------------------------
      "lemon lime" |     0xF1
    #-----------------------------
       strawberry  |    700_000
    #-----------------------------
    """)
void testWithCsvSource(String fruit, int rank) {
    // ...
}
```

rename.to: Can no longer use `#` as delimiter with `@CsvSource`

body:
Modifying the example from the User Guide as follows causes it to fail with the same exception in this issue's description.

```java
@ParameterizedTest
@CsvSource(delimiter = '#', quoteCharacter = '"', textBlock = """
	#-----------------------------
	#    FRUIT     #     RANK
	#-----------------------------
	     apple     #      1
	#-----------------------------
	     banana    #      2
	#-----------------------------
	  "lemon lime" #     0xF1
	#-----------------------------
	   strawberry  #    700_000
	#-----------------------------
	""")
void test(String fruit, int rank) {
	// ...
}
```

rename.from: Can no longer use `#` as delimiter with `@CsvSource`
rename.to: Can no longer use `#` as delimiter with `@CsvSource` and `@CsvFileSource`

issue.title: Introduce `commentCharacter` attribute in `@Csv{File}Source`

- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](https://docs.junit.org/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](https://docs.junit.org/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)

body:
> We should check if the pre-6.0 implementation based on univocity-parsers supported comments at all.

FWIW, I've been successfully using comments with 5.x and `@CsvFileSource` in relation to the use case mentioned at https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/issues/3818#issuecomment-3051416523. I don't have access to that set of use cases right now, but I can provide feedback in around two weeks, if it would be helpful.
